loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren, 41, lives with her husband and three children in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She leases an apartment with two rooms by the month in the downtown above an internet café. 

Her husband makes snuff-boxes at home and sells them to customers and souvenir shops. Myagmarsuren’s family owns a small land plot and a house. She and her husband want to plant some vegetables for their private use and to sell to increase the family income. She is planning to build a greenhouse in her backyard in which to plant vegetables. For this she needs building materials, such as iron pipes, cement and other necessary materials. 

Also she has a plan to repair her house walls to insulate them. Her old house has heat loss through the walls and roof.

She is taking a loan to buy the building materials for a greenhouse and to insulate her house walls.

loans.use: To buy building materials for a greenhouse and to insulate her house walls.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her bangles selling business. She started her business five years ago to share the financial burden with her husband whose income was not enough for the whole family. She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. All of them are getting their education. 

With this loan investment, Sajida will buy bangles of a larger variety and quantity that will help her make more sales and income - particularly for this coming Eid, which is a religious festival. Sajida is confident that by improving her business, she will be able to continue providing education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bangles for a bangles selling business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is single and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca-weaving business.

Gemma has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca-weaving business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman and has three children who attend school. She lives in the Likoni Mombasa where she works at her fish-selling stall. For the past ten years, she’s has been operating her stall to support her home. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her business more each time. She plans to use this loan to purchase bundles of fish for sale at a much more special price than usual because she has the capacity to buy at wholesale with her Kiva loan. This will make the investment successful.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jelyn is 32 years old and two of her children are in school.

Jelyn has a raffia-making business in the Philippines. Jelyn requested a 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her raffia-making business.

Jelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her raffia making.

loans.name: Grace Ann

texts.en:
Grace Ann works hard to support her family. Grace Ann is married and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Grace Ann requested a 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca-weaving business.

Grace Ann has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Grace Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Erika Anabel

texts.es: Erika se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, escogió esta actividad porque quería ayudar a su esposa con los gastos y como tiene 2 niños pequeños a quienes cuida no podía trabajar en una empresa. El trabajo es independiente y en la investigación que realizo le pareció rentable, empezó vendiendo bajo el código de otra persona pero esto no le ayudaba ya que quien ganaba las promociones por volúmenes de venta era su amiga. Cuando pudo reunir dinero para capitalizarse se acerco a la empresa y se registro con su propio código. El trabajo lo realiza sola haciendo recorridos y visitando a sus clientes ya sea para cobrar o entregar y recoger pedidos. Su horario normalmente es desde las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 11:00 y luego sale a las 15:00 hasta las 17:00 realiza este intervalo porque regresa a casa para atender a sus hijos. Erika vende productos como perfumes, maquillaje, lápices labiales etc., los cuales compra teniendo un margen del 30% en sus ventas. Vive en las Orquídeas y su esposo trabaja como chofer en una agencia de turismo. Con el préstamo va a comprar productos como perfumes, maquillaje, ropa y calzado para la venta esperada obtener mejores resultados. A futuro espera poder ponerse un negocio mejor establecido y así ayudar más en los ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Erika sells beauty products by catalogue. She chose this work because she wanted to help her husband with expenses and, as she has two small children to care for, she was not able to work for a business. She could work independently in this area and, in the investigation she conducted, it seemed to her that it was profitable. She began selling under another person’s account, but this did not help because it was her friend who won the sales promotions based on sales volumes and not her. When she was able to accumulate enough money to capitalize her own business, she went to the company and was registered with her own account. 

She works alone, traveling to visit her clients either to collect money or to take and deliver orders. Her schedule is normally from 9 in the morning until 11 a.m. and then she leaves again from 3 until 5 in the afternoons,  The interval at home allows her to take care of her children. Erika sells products such as makeup, lipsticks, etc., which she buys on a margin of 30% of sales. She lives in Las Orquideas and her husband works as a driver for a tourist agency. She will use the loan to buy products such as perfume, makeup, clothing and footwear and expects to earn more profit when she sells them. In the future she hopes to be able to have a better established business and thus help more with household income.

loans.use: to purchase makeup, clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 31 years old and married with three children who are aged between 5 and 15 years old and are school-going.

Lucy has a green grocer business and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy green grams, beans, and rice to add to her business stock for sale.

She hopes to expand her business and educate her children to university in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of green grams, beans, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is 56 years old. She is still very active and operates a shoe-making business. Her husband collects orders from the market, and both Sakina and her husband fulfill those orders by making shoes. The quality of their shoes is very good, which helps them get a good number of orders every month.

Sakina has seven sons, but she couldn’t provide them education due to financial constraints. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah because she has a large order to fulfill. With the loan investment she will buy leathers and shoe laces in larger quantity and of better quality, which will help her completing the orders on time.

She has been operating this business with her husband for many years and is confident about her family's business success after receiving the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding Asasah Passbook is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy leather and laces for her shoe making and selling business

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 34 years old. She is married to John and together they have one child aged 14 years old. She operates a green grocery and has been in the business for the past 10 years. She gets a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of vegetables and fruits for sale.

She hopes to purchase a plot of land where they can put up a house.

loans.use: to purchase stock of vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 33, resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Felicito. She is the mother of three children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating their business.

Vilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory, and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vilma hopes to have her own house and that her children will have a good quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 59 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Leonila has been in this business for five years. In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 38 years old and married with three children. He runs a green grocer business. He has been in this business for five years earning a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more stock of assorted vegetables, carrots and tomatoes for sale. He plans to use the anticipated profit to increase and expand the business.

His future hopes and dreams are to meet his clients' needs and achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to buy more stock of assorted vegetables, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca-weaving business.

NWTF is relisting Lorna's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca-weaving business.

NWTF is relisting Lorelie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Coralia

texts.es: La señora Coralia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene un taller de costura y bordados desde hace 8 años  e invertirá el crédito en la compra de telas, hilos, elástico, manta, crochet.
texts.en: Coralia is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has had a sewing and embroidery workshop for 8 years. She will invest the loan in buying fabric, thread, elastic, blankets and crocheted items.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Holman

texts.es:
El señor Holman quien se dedica a la agricultura actividad que aprendió desde muy joven. El crédito lo invertirá en el cultivo de tomate y en mejoras al invernadero.
Él está casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 8 y 6 años los cuales estudian.
texts.en:
Holman is a farmer. He learned this activity when he was very young. He will invest the loan in growing tomatoes and in improving his greenhouse. 

He is married and has four children, aged 14, 12, 8 and 6. They are in school.

loans.use: to grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has an abaca weaving business. As the married mother of six children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

Lilia is borrowing PhP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She is confident that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to repair and renovate the family home.

loans.use: to buy materials for abaca weaving

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: Héctor es mecánico de profesión con muchos años de experiencia, vive en la Orquídeas y su casa es de ladrillo contando con todos los servicios básicos. Empezó trabajando a los 21 años en un taller como ayudante de mecánica, su mayor reto era aprender para en un futuro ser independiente. En la actualidad tiene un taller pero realiza más su trabajo a domicilio. Héctor también tiene una camioneta en la cual brinda el servicio de fletes, estas dos actividades son las que le ayudan a solventar su economía. Realiza el trabajo solo y no tiene un horario establecido como es soltero pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo fuera de casa. El crédito que solicita y espera conseguir es para mejorar su vivienda ya que no tiene acabados, comprara arena, cemento, piedras, baldosas.
texts.en:
Héctor is a mechanic with many years of experience.  He lives in Orquídeas, and he has a brick house with all of the basic services.

When he was 21 years old he started working in a shop as an assistant mechanic.  His biggest goal was to learn in order to become independent in the future.

He currently has a shop, but he does more home-based work.  Héctor also has a pick-up truck with which he provides freight service.  These two business activities are those that help him settle his finances.

He works alone, and he does not have an established schedule.  As he is single, he spends most of his time away from home.

The loan he is requesting and hoping to get is to improve his home because it is not finished.  He will buy sand, stones, and tiles.

loans.use: to buy sand, stones, and tiles.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie has a raffia making business. She has been engaged in this business for six years. She is unmarried and works hard to help support her extended family.

Rosalie requested a PhP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raffia for her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raffia for her business

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is married with five children.  He operates a retail shop and has been in this business for ten years.  Raphael's monthly income is eleven thousand shillings.

This will be his third loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more rice, sugar and flour for sale.

Raphael plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his business.  His future hopes and dreams are to have a well and comfortable life and to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar and flour for sale.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 55 years old. She is a widow, the mother of five grown children. She is a poultry farmer, besides owning a hotel and a posho mill for grinding maize and other grains.  She has been in the business for the past four years. She gets a monthly income of KES 10,000.


This will be her first loan through KADET LTD.  She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase chicks and chicken feeds so as to boost her poultry farming.


She hopes to seek medical help for her heart problem after her business stabilizes.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds to boost her poultry farming.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian is from Likoni.  He drives a motorcycle taxi, is married and has two children.

He has worked as a taxi driver for 4 years.  Ian lives with his family and decided to start this business, thinking of his own progress and that of his family.

Ian remarks that his job is very difficult because during the rainy season he has a lot of challenges since there are fewer passengers, since it's cold.  His dream is to buy more motorcycles and to progress more every day.

He is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi, since it is an essential part of his job.  He is happy for opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 24 years old from Nakuru, and is married with three children who are between five and one years of age.

He has a motorcycle business that he started two years ago.  He has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

Julius hopes to build his own house in the near future and expand his transport business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a business selling wine, spirits, and soft drinks. She started her business because of her need to generate an income to improve her family’s standard of living. Mary lives with her husband and their two children. Her main clients are her neighbors and members of the local community. 

Mary is requesting her second loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization she has been a part of for two years and that made it possible for her to set up her business. She will use the loan to buy crates of beer and soda and to renovate her business. Such renovation will allow her to respond to opportunities in the market, such as attracting new customers that have been referred by current buyers and to market her establishment to new clients. This is the reason she is asking for this Kiva loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust. With her loan, she will also buy supplies in larger quantities, which will allow her to buy at a cash discount and obtain wares in larger volumes.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and soda and to renovate her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 34 year old married man who has a daughter who is three years old.  He describes himself as a determined man. 

He operates a retail store where he sells machinery.  He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member.  His business is located at a lucrative area and his primary customers are locals. 

Francis describes his biggest business challenge is the high cost of machinery.  He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more machinery for his shop. 

His business goal is to expand within five years.  Francis hopes that in the future, he will have opened many more mechanic shops.

loans.use: to buy more machinery.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Nuru runs a food stall business. She has been engaged in her business for one year now. She works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. She is in her early 30s and is unmarried.

This will be Nuru's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She intends to use her loan funds to increase the stock of items for her food stall. Nuru will share this loan with her loan group Sisi Kwa Sisi, which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Her dream is one day to be able to own a hotel.

loans.use: to increase the stock of items for her food stall

loans.name: Las Chicas Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
Este comité de la ciudad de San Ignacio está en el ciclo nº 5,  mantienen el grupo por medio de sus reuniones y ayudas mutuas..El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es seguir trabajando, fomentar el espiritu solidario y mantener la unidad y la disciplina del grupo.
La sra.Maria es parte del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de joyas, como ser pulseras, anillos, cadenas, aros y demás. Ella tiene buena habilidad para las ventas, y es por ello que le va muy bien y esta creciendo con su negocio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas de plata, con lo cual podrá seguir creciendo y ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee, from the city of San Ignacio, are on their fifth loan cycle.  They keep the group going through their meetings and mutual help.  The aim of every member is to continue working, promoting a supportive spirit and maintaining group unity and discipline.

Maria is a member of this group.  She says that her business is selling all kinds of jewelry such as bracelets, rings, chains, earrings, etc.  She is very skilled in making sales and so she is doing very well and growing her business.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy silver jewelry.  This will help her to continue growing her business and offering a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam attracts many clients because he is a sociable person. He can quickly make the acquaintance of many people and develop his business. 

For more than thirty-four years he has been busy with driving. At first, he worked in the carpet factory as a driver, but after some time he was in labor reduction and stopped his activity in the factory. 

He hired a bus for serving local people going from one place to another. Uktam is persevering and his hard work helped him to develop his business. Now he has his own minibus and his business has been developing year by year. 

Uktam’s family is large. He has a lovely wife and five children. His wife is a housewife and that’s why Uktam must comfort his family with all necessary things alone. 

His house is small for his large family. He is going to build a new house but he does not have the money for it. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials to build a new house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood to build a new house.

loans.name: Expedito

texts.es:
El señor Expedito tiene 47 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Curuguaty. El es Comerciante, de profesión FOTOGRAFO, se dedica a la producción de Fotografías y Video Filmaciones en general. Tiene experiencia de 30 años en este trabajo.
Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela debido a que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y trata de dar lo mejor de si en cada proyecto que tiene. Su meta es poder tener un gran estudio de fotografía y poder seguir trabajado y creciendo como microempresario.
Solicita el crédito que será destinado a la compra de una maquina reveladora para poder aumentar de producción y así por crecer económicamente y profesionalmente.-
texts.en:
Expedito is 47 years old and lives in the city of Curuguaty.  He is a photographer by profession.  He takes photos and makes videos.  He has 30 years experience in this work.

Expedito says that he has a very good customer base because he always does good work and tries to give his best in every project that he undertakes.  His goal is to have a large photography studio.  He would like to continue working and growing as a micro-businessman.

Expedito is requesting this loan to buy a photo developing machine so that he can increase his production and grow both financially and professionally.

loans.use: to buy a photo developing machine

loans.name: Choga

texts.en:
Choga lives in Kwale, Kenya. He is the father of seven children, all of whom still attend school. He works in the traditional art of dressmaking. 

With this activity, he has generated income to support his household while he was selling clothes. He needed to attain economic independence, to support their children’s well-being, and provide professional education so that they can be successful in the future.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan. He plans to use the loan to buy raw materials and supplies to make uniforms for school-going children. He has orders and he needs to make purchases in large volume to earn good discounts so that his offer will be competitive. 

His goal for later on is to attain a good market position, to hire employees, and to dedicate himself to running his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies to make uniforms for school-going children.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Isabel, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica a su actividad principal que es la de administrativa en un colegio de la ciudad, pero también se dedica a una actividad paralela y no menos importante que es la artesanía, principalmente en la elaboración de elementos bordados,. Isabel en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar material como Hilos de colores y telas para realizar sus bordados.
Isabel está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our partner is Isabel. She belongs to the communal bank Los Lideres (The Leaders) in the city of Cusco, Perú. She works as an administrator at a school in the city, but she is also dedicated to a parallel activity of no less importance: handicrafts, mainly the production of embroidered works.

With this opportunity, Isabel will use the requested loan to buy material, like colored thread and fabric, for her embroidery. Isabel is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to provide a better quality of life for her family and for helping her with the growth and strengthening of her work. She appreciates the loan and is committed to paying off her debt in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: To buy material, such as thread, for her handicrafts.

loans.name: Wani

texts.en:
Wani, age 30, runs a general store. He has been in business for four years. He lives in Juba with his wife and two children, ages three and five. The children are both enrolled in school. 

Wani heard about Finance Sudan through a promotion by the officers. He is taking out a loan of 3,500 SDG in order to purchase milk, sugar, tea leaves,  and other such items. The family has no other source of income.

In five years, Wani would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices.

Wani reports that he is happy to be the recipient of this loan given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase such items as milk, sugar, and tea leaves to offer for sale

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared  is a 43-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be an honest man. He runs an insurance service business where he sells insurance policies. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a lucrative business area  and his primary customers are residents from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low demand for purchase of the policies. 

Jared will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a computer. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have opened a retail store for his wife.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Las Roseñas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Las Roseñas"se origino por medio de una de las miembros del grupo. Actualmente este grupo trabaja unido y se ayudan las unas a las otras y siempre tratan de ser mejores cada día.
Julia es una de las miembros de este grupo y cuenta que tiene una peluquería donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Es una persona muy sacrificada con muchos deseos de crecer y de superarse y darle lo mejor a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuague, tijeras y demás insumos para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y también poder darle una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
"Las Roseñas" Communal Bank was started through the efforts of one of its members. Currently this group works as a team that helps one another. They always try to improve every day.

Julia is one of the members of this group. She owns a beauty shop where she works every day starting very early. She is a person who has made many sacrifices and who greatly wants to grow and succeed and give the best to her family. She is applying for a loan to buy tints, shampoo, conditioner, scissors and other supplies in order to be able to continue helping her family and also to be able to provide good service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase tints, shampoo, condition, scissors and other supplies.

loans.name: Jasem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has six children.

Jasem owns a food market since 2011, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3000 as a loan in order to buy two refrigerators and a small generator. He also wants to increase supplies. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators and a small generator

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 33 years old, married and a father of two children. For the last five years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his hardware based in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 25,000.

 He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for his first loan, of KES 100,000, to buy additional stock such as paint brushes, paint, door locks, and hammers for sale.

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his children's school fees and continue taking care of his family. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business into a well established hardware store in the region so that he may be able to improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as paint brushes, paint, door locks, and hammers

loans.name: Leodegario

texts.en:
Leodegario is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 58 years old and married with three children. To make a living, Leodegario is providing a junkshop business in the local community. Leodegario has been engaged in his business for six years and earns 15,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Leodegario joined Kiva partner GDMPC. Leodegario is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to buy more junk items to resell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy more junk items to resell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school. Vilma is in an agricultural business raising hogs in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Vilma has been hog raising for five years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is married with four children. She is 58 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. To earn a living, Martina has a small general store. She has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her snack vending business. 

Martina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months. In the future, Martina hopes to grow and sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her snack vending business

loans.name: James Martin

texts.en:
James  is a 40-year-old  businessman  who lives in Juba. He is married and has five children between the ages of 18  and 5. All of them go to school.

James  runs a general store and has been in business for eight years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through a  promotion by the officers. He is taking a loan of  4000 SDG to purchase milk, sugar, tea leaves  and many other items.  In addition to this business, James has no other source of income.

In five years James  would like to expand his business and open other  branches. His  major challenges include high  prices in the market.

James  says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan  through  the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like milk, oil, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is an entrepreneur who has made progress in his goal thanks to his capacity for work and love for his family, which consists of his six children. He is the owner of a business through which he generates income for the family, managing his business of selling goat meat.  

Little by little Mohamed has been able to expand what he offers; delivering his products to clients on time, now he has a domestic market made up of his neighbors. His dream is to grow and expand his market, but his working capital is often insufficient in order to meet his goal of prosperity. This is the reason for which he is asking for a Kiva loan, his second financing through the Yehu Microfinance Trust, in order to purchase more goats with which he will be able to get substantial discounts by buying in volume. This is the groundwork for the success of his Kiva loan that has him enthused and dreaming.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 62 years old with  eight children.  She is married and lives in Cabal-asan, Maria, Siquijor.

To earn a living, Victoria is a farmer and grows assorted vegetables in the backyard. She has been doing this for 10 years. She is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase materials for constructing a "vermi-composting" system to produce an organic fertilizer as the major usage in the garden.

Victoria has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months.  In the future, Victoria hopes to have more savings deposit out of income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a vermi-composting business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 6 años y es dueña de su propio negocio de internet. Gracias a FINCA Perú ella pudo tener su negocio propio y mejoró la economía de su hogar, le gustan las reuniones  de su Banco Comunal y las Ferias de Salud que brinda la institución. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la implementación del local de su negocio como la compra de estantes y el mantenimiento de sus computadoras.
texts.en: Gladys is a member of the Tarpuy II communal bank. She is 29 years old and a single mother of a 1 year old. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for more than 6 years and is the owner of her own internet business. Thanks to FINCA Perú, she was able to have her own business and improve her family's finances. She likes her communal bank's meetings and the health fairs that the institution offers. The loan that she is asking for will be invested in outfitting her business locale by buying shelves and doing maintenance on her computers.

loans.use: to buy shelves and to do maintenance on her computers.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 48, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rodrigo, a carpenter, and a mother to her five children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Zenaida sells balut and some crackers.  A balut is a fertilized duck embryo that is boiled and eaten in the shell. Popularly believed to be an aphrodisiac and considered a high-protein, hearty snack, balut are mostly sold by street vendors in the regions where they are available. It is commonly sold as street  food in thePhilippines. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of balut and crackers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Zenaida dreams of growing her business and being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for stocks of balut and crackers needed in her business.

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es: Eduardo, de 50 años de edad, es originario de Managua, se dedica a atender una pulpería en su casa de habitación, el es padre de dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes. El  comenzó su negocio  hace 4 años ya que tenía necesidad de generara ingresos para mantener la educación de sus hijos y pagar los gastos de su hogar. Antes se dedicaba a vender productos y  atender un cyber pero no era suficiente para pagar los gastos pero poco a poco fue poniendo productos en su casa para vender y después de un tiempo logro pone su pulpería. Este se ha convertido en su único medio de subsistencia y con el cual ha mantenido a su familia. El tiene como expectativa lograr convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora bien surtido donde sus clientes encuentren de todo lo necesario para abastecer sus hogares de productos alimenticios. El está requiriendo el préstamo Kiva para comprar granos básicos, leche, pan , huevo, jugos, papel de baño, productos de limpieza , ya que son de mucha necesidad y demanda entre su clientela .  También tiene como proyecto alquilar cuartos para estudiantes y ofrecer este servicio ya que ha notado que tiene demanda entre los jóvenes que vienen de largo  a estudiar a la capital
texts.en:
Eduardo, 50, is a native of Managua. He runs a small store in his home and is the father of two sons, both of whom are independent. He began his business four years ago because he needed to generate an income to pay for his children’s education and to cover household expenses. Previously he sold products and ran a cyber café but did not earn enough to pay his expenses.  However, he gradually began moving products to his house to sell and after a time he succeeded in establishing his store. This has become his only source of income and he has been able to support his family. He plans to convert his store into a well stocked distribution center where his customers will find all they need to supply their homes with household products. 

Eduardo is requesting a Kiva loan to buy basic grains, milk, bread, eggs, juices, toilet paper, cleaning supplies because these are the items most requested by his customers. He also has a project in mind to rent rooms to students and offer this service because he has noticed that there is a demand among those students who travel a long distance to study in the capital

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, milk, bread, eggs, juice, toilet paper and cleaning products.

loans.name: Gavsiddin

texts.en:
Gavsiddin has operated an animal husbandry business for more than 3 years. He buys cattle, cares for them for 3 or 4 months and sells them to local people for a low price. He has many customers. many of them butchers. All of his customers are glad about his work because his cattle are fat and well cared for.

Gavsiddin has a lovely wife and a child. He loves his family very much. Since he wants to develop his business, Gavsiddin is asking a loan to buy young cattle. He needs your help and support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda y es madre de 9 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de flores. Ella dice que con la ayuda de FINCA Perú, logró ahorrar y comprar cosas para su vivienda e implementar más su negocio. Le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal donde dice que aprende mucho a ahorrar, a invertir en su negocio y también aprende como cuidar su salud. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de flores como margaritas, girasoles, rosas, claveles, etc.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Tarpuy II Communal Bank.  She is 65 years old, a widow and the mother of nine children. She sells flowers. She says that with the help of FINCA Peru, she was able to save and buy items for her home and expand her business. She enjoys the training workshops offered by her communal bank where, she says, she learns a great deal about saving and investing in her business.  She also learns how to take care of her health. 

She will invest the loan she is requesting in purchasing flowers like daisies, sun flowers, roses and carnations.

loans.use: to purchase flowers such as daisies, sun flowers, roses, carnations, etc.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man who describes himself as very ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells milk. Moses has been involved in this business for 7 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located in a conducive business area  and his primary customers are hotels and residents within the area. Moses describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy containers for milk storage. Moses' business goal is to be a milk supplier within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have improved his business.

loans.use: to buy milk storage containers.

loans.name: Celnape

texts.en:
Celnape, 35 years old, is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has three children. Celnape operates a general store in the local community, selling a variety of food and household products. She has been in business for 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from it.

Celnape is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2006, Celnape joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman is an entrepreneur who has made progress in his goals thanks to his capacity for work and his love for his family, which consists of his wife and five children, all of whom attend school. He owns and manages a movie shop business and began a second business 2 years ago, selling goats for meat, Little by little, Suleiman has been able to expand what he offers - selling the latest movies and now having a domestic market made up of his neighbors. He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy CD’s and the latest movies in large volume, so as to get substantial discounts. This is the groundwork for the success of his Kiva loan that enables him to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy CD’s and the latest movies

loans.name: Gai Bol

texts.en:
Gai is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 2 children, aged 7 and 5, both attending school. Gai  has operated a bar/hotel for 6 years and has two  employees. He has no other source of income. Gai heard about Finance Sudan through its officers' promotion. He is taking a loan of  4,000 SDG to purchase chairs, beer, soda and many other items.  

Gai's major challenge is high  prices in the market. In 5 years, he would like to expand his business and open other  branches. Gai says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items such as fridges, soda, beer, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with seven children. 

Evelyn has a hog-fattening business and earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to be use in purchasing feeds. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 43-year old and married, with two children.  She lives in San Carlos, Tukuran. Her husband is a municipal employee. 

In order to add income in the family, Nenita entered into the business of buying and selling rice 10 years ago. Nenita usually gets PHP 10,000 per month.

With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Nenita was able to buy more rice products to sell because of the PHP 10,000 rendered to her. Nenita joined GDMPC in 2008. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more rice products to sell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 years old, married, and the father of three children. For the last seven years, he has earned a living by repairing bicycles for residents of Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers.  He is applying for his third loan of KES 50,000, to buy additional equipment such as wrenches and a small welding machine for his business, which he is seeking to expand.

He will use the profits to pay his children's school fees as well as to continue looking after his family. His goal for the future is to turn his workshop into a welding business, whereby he would be repairing almost anything that involves metal. This will enable him to improve his earnings and lift up his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment such as wrenches and a small welding machine.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 37-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be optimistic.

She operates a retail stall where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more shoes for selling. Her business goal is to restock her business within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will diversify her business by opening a stationery retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari lives in Likoni, Mombasa. He works every day because his dream is to have a shop that is well-known in his town. In order to do this, he sells at a retail shop to his neighbors and passers-by. With this, he has managed to save and invest in another business: farming vegetables and fruits, which has provided the opportunity to generate new income.

The lack of working capital in the face of Bakari’s dreams is his biggest challenge.  This is why he has turned to Kiva credit, his second loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With his Kiva credit, he will buy bales of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar, which are all in high demand during this rainy season. 

His loan should be successful because his sales are based on customer orders.  What he buys has a fast turnover, which causes his working capital to turn quickly and therefore increase his profits. Choosing good customers would increase the recovery of his capital and thereby his earnings.

loans.use: to buy bales of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en: Mavzuna wants for all women to wear beautiful clothes. With this aim, some years ago she began her own business selling women's clothes. She is a very successful business lady, as she knows all aspects of her trade very well. Her experience helps her develop her business. Her colleagues know her as glorious and intelligent. She has two children and a lovely husband. Mavzuna manages the business alone. She wants to have a wide assortment of goods, but she does not have the money for that, and that’s why she is asking for a loan from you. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for widening her assortment

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita used her previous loan to buy snack foods to sell.  Her business has grown up and become successful.  

She is now busy in her other type of business, hog raising. She's taking a new loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Setei

texts.en:
Setei is 27 years old, married to Saitoti and blessed with four children that they support. She has been a mixed crop farmer, for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES.10,000. 

He has applied for her second loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase farm inputs e.g. fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for labor. 

She will invest the anticipated profits back into her business. Her dreams for the future are to have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like pesticides, fertilizers, and labor

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 30 years old and married with one child. She runs a farm and motorcycle business. She has been in this business for two years earning a monthly income of 21,000 shillings. This will be her second loan from KADET Ltd, which she will use to buy a dairy cow. She plans to use the anticipated profit to buy more livestock. She hopes to be a prosperous business lady in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy  cow

loans.name: Lovilla

texts.en:
Lovilla is single and has no children. She is 27 years old and lives in Labo, Aloran.
Lovilla is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. Lovilla has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional feeds. 
Lovilla has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca has been able to operate her retail shop business thanks to her previous Yehu loans with which she had bought supplies such sundry products in large quantities. Currently, she is applying for a new Kiva loan which she will use to buy supplies, expecting an increase in product needs. She can benefit from buying them with cash and in larger quantities than usual. She sends the following message to the Kiva backers: "I am very grateful for the financing of my project since you have given me the opportunity to increase my production and my income."

loans.use: to buy supplies, expecting an increase in product needs.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is 42 years old and single with two children. She operates a green grocer business. She has been in this business for seven years, earning a monthly income of 8,100 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family. This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd, and she plans to use it to purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profit to add stock and expand the business. She hopes and dreams to be stable in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits for sale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 5 years and 10 years. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail stall where she sells plastic items such as water bottles. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a residential area  and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business . She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more plastic items to resell. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have opened new retail stores selling plastics.

loans.use: to buy plastic bottles for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a married woman with 2 children. She is 45 years old, residing in San Carlos, Tukuran. Gloria owns and operates a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair the borrower's fishing boat. Gloria has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Gloria wants to build a house and to finish the study of her children.

loans.use: to repair the borrower's fishing boat

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with 4 children. She is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosita is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 36 years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Rosita hopes to acquire a lot for her investment .

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like pesticides, fertilizer, and labor

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old from Nakuru and is married with three children who are all in school.

Margaret has a charcoal selling business which she has been doing for the past four years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more charcoal to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to educate her children well until they reach university level.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to add to her stock for sale.

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: Doña Paula vive en el municipio de la Concepcion Masaya, su esposo y ella se esfuerzaz mucho para poder darles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida y sobre todo resliazar su mas grande sueño contruir su casa. ella tiene de muchos años su negocito vende frutas y verduras su esposo la apoya en los gastos del hogar pero no han podido recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para comprar materiales, con este nuevo financiamiento ellos podran comprar lo necesdario para emprender la construccion: Bloques, Cemento, Viajes de Arena, Viajes de Piedrin, Hierros. ellos esperan seguir contando con el apoyo de Afodenic quien atravez de fondos Kiva ayudan a personas de escasos recursos como ellos.
texts.en:
Paula lives in the municipality of Concepción Masaya. She and her husband try very hard to be able to provide their children with better living conditions, and above all to fulfill their greatest dream of building a house. For many years, she has had a small business selling fruits and vegetables. Her husband supports her with the home expenses, but he has not been able to save enough money all at once to begin construction.

With this new loan, they will be able to purchase the necessary items to start the construction, such as blocks, cement, loads of sand and gravel, and iron. They hope to continue saving with the support of AFODENIC, which through loans from Kiva helps people with limited resources like themselves.

loans.use: to purchase blocks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron.

loans.name: Uzul

texts.ru:
Узул проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 46 лет. Она вдова. У нее четверо детей. Узул мужественная и порядочная женщина. После того как ее муж покинул ее. Узул занялась животноводством. В этой области Узул имела богатый опыт, что помогло ей расширить свою деятельность и заработать чтобы обеспечит детей всем необходимым. 
На сегодняшний день Узул продолжает свою деятельность. В этом ей помогает ее старший сын. Животноводство - является единственным источником дохода в ее семье. Узул просит кредит для закупа овец и телят с целью увеличения поголовья скота. 
Узул хочет за счет полученной прибыли от продажи скота устроить свадьбу сына. Она надеется, что ее услышат.
texts.en:
Uzul lives in the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan. She's a 46-year-old widow raising 4 children. Uzul is very respectable and courageous. After her husband left her, she started breeding animals to make a living. She's very experienced in this area and that has helped her to expand her business and earn enough money to ensure her children's needs are met. Today, she runs her business with the assistance of her oldest son. This is their only source of income. 

Uzul is asking for a loan in order to purchase some sheep and calves and increase the size of her herd. She plans to use some of the profits to pay for her sons wedding. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and calves.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
This is Alfred, 48, a resident of Manila, Philippines. He is married to Gregoria, a vendor, and a father to his child. He, together with his wife and children, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his family's everyday expenses.  

Alfred sells balut and crackers. Balut, fertilized duck embryo boiled in the shell, is a popular street food in the Philippines. Alfred's regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of balut and crackers. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Alfred dreams of growing his business and giving all his children a good education through all his hard work on his business. He also hopes to have his own restaurant. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: Don Pablo ,  originario, casado de Managua es un humilde comerciante el cual es dueño de un pequeño Cyber café ubicado en su casa de habitación, el junto con su hijo menor administran el negocio lleva 6 años con este negocio antes se dedica  la contabilidad pero al jubilarse decidió poner este negocio para buscar otra manera de sobrevivir y apoyar a su hijo quien estudia Ingeniería en sistemas, antes le ayudaba su hija mayor pero ella murió , esto le sirvió para poder soportar el dolor de haber perdido a su hija y de seguir adelante para no dejar caer el negocio. Impulsado por el deseo de superación y como una forma de rendirle honor a su hija el continua trabajando duro para brindar una mejor calidad en sus servicios tener maquinas un poco más modernas, acondicionar mejor el lugar pues la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes estudiantes quienes realizan sus tareas y proyectos en el Cyber  y ellos siempre buscan lo mejor y más moderno. Es por ello que está solicitando el crédito para comprar disco duros, monitores de computadoras, tarjetas de memoria, pintura para darle una mejor apariencia a los módulos donde tiene ubicadas las maquinas. Esto le será de mucha ayuda para poder brindar un mejor y diferenciado servicio a sus clientes quienes siempre buscan lo mejor. El tiene como meta poner el servicio ce llamadas internacionales, trabajar con tecnología avanzada y vender modernos software.
texts.en:
Don Pablo, married and a native of Managua, is an unassuming merchant who is the owner of a small cyber café located in his home. He, together with his youngest son, manages the business, which he has had for six years. Previously he was an accountant however when he retired he decided to start this business in order to find another way of surviving and supporting his son who was a student in systems engineering. Prior to that,  he had helped his older daughter, however she passed away. Assisting his son has helped him bear the pain of losing his daughter. It has enabled him to move forward and avoid losing his business.

Motivated by a wish to overcome the loss and as a way to honor his daughter, he continues working hard to offer a better quality of service, to have machines that are a bit more modern and to better equip the space. The majority of his clients are young students who do their homework and projects in the cyber café and they also look for the best and most modern products. Consequently he is requesting a loan to purchase hard disks, computer monitors, memory cards and paint to give a better appearance to the modules where the machines are located.  The loan will be a great help and enable him to offer better and specific services to his clients, who are always looking for the best.

Don Pablo’s goals are to install an international call service, to work with advanced technology and to sell modern software.

loans.use: to purchase hard disks, computer monitors, memory cards and paint.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 27 años de edad y es madre de 1 hijo. Es socia de socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años y se dedica a la venta de frutas por mayor y menor. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ella pudo implementar su negocio que comparte con su mamá, logró aumentar su mercadería. Le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal y hace todo el esfuerzo para no faltar a ninguna reunión. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de frutas como naranjas, mandarinas, plátanos, uvas, papayas, sandías, manzanas, etc., para llevar a las ferias y vender en su puesto.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Tarpuy II Communal Bank. She is 27 years old and the mother of a son. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years and sells fruit, both wholesale and retail. During her time as a member of FINCA Peru, she was able to start her business, which she shares with her mother, and to expand her merchandise.

She enjoys the training workshops offered by her communal bank and makes every effort to not miss a single meeting. The loan she is requesting will be invested in purchasing fruits, such as oranges, mandarins, bananas, grapes, papayas, watermelons, apples, etc, which she will take to the markets and sell from her stall.

loans.use: to purchase fruits such as oranges, mandarins, bananas, grapes, papayas, watermelon, apples, etc.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y madre de 12 hijos los cuales todos son mayores de edad e independientes. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 5 años y tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ropa. Ella agradece a FINCA Perú porque con el primer préstamo que obtuvo logró abrir su negocio y ahora gracias a ese capital se encuentra bien y tranquila junto a su familia, también le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal por que le enseñan mucho y son divertidas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como ropa de invierno para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of Tarpuy II Communal Bank. She is 64 years old, married and the mother of 12 children, all of whom are adults and independent. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than five years and has a business buying and selling clothing. She is grateful to FINCA Peru because, with her first loan, she succeeded in starting her business and now, thanks to that capital, she and her family are happy and well.

She also enjoys the training workshops offered by her communal bank because they teach her a great deal and are entertaining. She will invest the loan she is requesting in purchasing merchandise, such as winter clothing for men, women and children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as winter clothing for women, gentlemen and children.

loans.name: Ricarido

texts.en:
Ricarido is 52 years old and lives in Bernad Subdivision, Ozamiz City. He is married with 2 children. 

Ricarido has a store that sells a variety of products. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Ricarido has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 70 years old, married, and the father of three children. For the last 30 years, he has earned a living by farming and selling his produce to his clients in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his third loan, for KES 24,000, to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to ensure that his produce is well taken care of. He will use the anticipated profit to continue looking after his family.

His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming so that he may continue providing his family with a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.es: Gertrudes es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de quesos. Ella dice que le gusta ser parte de FINCA Perú por que aprendió mucho la puntualidad, también le gustan las Campañas de Salud por que son para personas de bajos recursos, se les da una oportunidad a las personas que no tienen dinero para asistir a un doctor. El préstamo que solicita  lo invertirá en la compra de queso para que lleve a vender a las ferias y el mercado.
texts.en:
Gertrudes is a member of the "Tarpuy II" communal bank. She is 43, married, and the mother of five children. She sells cheese.

She says that she likes being part of Finca Perú, because she really learned to make payments on time. She also likes the health campaigns because they are for low-income people. It gives people who don't have money the opportunity to go to a doctor. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of cheese that she will sell at fairs and markets.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cheeses.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda is a clever woman with a high degree. She is a teacher in the local school. She has many pupils and all of them love her very much. Mavjuda works with pleasure because she likes her job. Her husband went to Russia to find a job. She has a son and cares about his future life. This year her son is going to be married to a lovely girl, but their house is small and in bad condition. Mavjuda wants to build a new house for him and his future wife. Her husband can’t help her and you are the only one who can help her. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials such as wood, cement, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood and cement for building a new house

loans.name: Francis Nyamai

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old from Nakuru and is married with three children, who are aged between seven and 18. 

He has a scrap metal business that he has been running for the past seven years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more scrap metal to add to his stock.

He hopes to educate his children and expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal to add to his stock.

loans.name: Puissance De Philibert 4 Group

texts.fr:
Milain est le coordinateur de son groupe Puissance de Philibert 4. Il est marié et il a 3 enfants. Il habite dans la région philibert d’Haiti il n’a pas de l’éléctricité et de l’eau est très limitée.

Milain a dirigé son business de produit divers pendant les dernières 3 années. Milain voudrait utiliser d'investir dans l'achat de différents produits comme les cosmétiques, les vêtements, les chaussures. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à progresse

Des autres membres de puissance de Philibert ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme Charbon, vêtements et produit divers.

Milain dit que son défi principal est manquement de l’argent. Il dit que son but principal être devenir un grand commerçant et est faire plus de bénéfice son rêve est acheter un véhicule.
texts.en:
Milain is the coordinator of his group "Puissance de Philibert 4".  He is married and has three children.  He lives in the Philibert region of Haiti where there is no electricity and where the water supply is very limited.

Milain has been managing his business for the past three years (he sells various goods).  He would like to use his loan to invest in the purchase of various goods such as cosmetics, clothes and shoes.  He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business.

The other members of the group "Puissance de Philibert" need a loan to finance such activities as the sale of charcoal, clothes and various goods.

Milain says that his main challenge is the lack of money.  His main goal is to become a major retailer and make more profits.  His dream is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as cosmetics, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet says that the first loan has helped pay part of her children's school fees, and she has increased her business stock. She is also happy to take more loans from Finance Sudan. The other people in the photo are clients and a worker.

loans.use: to purchase more weaves, plastic chairs for the customers, and other related items.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is married, and leaves in Tiribe, Kenya. She is a good entrepreneur, and for three years she has owned her own business. She has operated a palm leaves for roof thatch selling business for the past three years.

Today her dreams continue to grow and her goals are to continue increasing her income. She plans to establish a retail shop business and expand to a wholesale shop and to be very successful.

Her market is growing and so is the amount of capital that she needs to continue providing the products her customers demand. This will be her first loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy bundles of palm leaves that she will promote in her business with special discounts. She wants to offer great prices to her customers so that she can continue earning their loyalty, and this is why she will be successful in investing her Credit Kiva loan in her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of palm leaves.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 24-year-old married woman. She has a son who is three years old. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail stall where she sells plastic items such as water bottles. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a conducive business environment and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more plastic items. Her business goal is to restock her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify her business whereby she looks forward to exporting her plastics to customers internationally.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items such as water bottles to sell.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman with two children. She lives in Tiribe town, Kenya. She has sold household consumables at her Kiosk shop for the last year. Nzadze's business has allowed her to get ahead, to earn enough income to have some comforts. Her goal is to expand her business more so that she can expand her profits further. 

Nzadze is currently planning to take out her first credit thanks to Kiva, which will be her first funding through Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy retail shop items like maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She generates good profits when she buys in bulk, which is what she plans to do in this instance.

loans.use: to buy retail shop items like maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married with five children. Rosa is 47 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan Oroquieta City.

Rosa is engaged in buying and selling to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Rosa has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Rosa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with three children who are aged between 30 and 22 years old.

Cecilia is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm. 

She hopes to see her farm produce enough harvest and to make good income from it in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Benard is a 34-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from nine months to 11 years old. He describes himself as a jovial man. He operates a bicycle with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a profitable business area and his primary customers are local residents from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor impassible roads especially when it rains. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a new bicycle to improve his mode of transportation for customers. His business goal is to expand his business into taxi transportation services within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new bicycle.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 42 years old and lives in Canicapan, Clarin. Juliet is married with three children. Juliet has a store that sells variety of products. Juliet has had this business for three years.

Juliet requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Juliet hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Hoan

texts.en:
Hoan, aged 28, appears in the photo with her spouse. They live happily in a small village in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. This couple has given birth to two children, both of whom are enrolled in a local school in the province. Hoan runs an off-license from her own home to supplement the main income of the family.  Her husband helps her in the business when he gets free from doing farm work.

Hoan wants to renovate her store and satisfy her clients, so she is taking out a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to purchase timbers and construction supplies needed for the construction. This will enable her to make her business more viable and profitable in the future. She hopes that she will be able to earn a better income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase timbers and construction supplies needed to construct her store.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 35 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela. Riza is married with three children. Riza has a store that sells variety of products. Riza has had this business for five years.

Riza requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Riza has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Riza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Haydarhuja

texts.en:
Haydarhuja is a man who likes to work very hard. For more than 15 years he has worked in his garden from early morning till late evening. There are many fruit trees in his garden. He is busy preparing ‘kuraga’ (dried fruit) from apricots. Haydarhuja collects fresh apricots, dries them and makes ‘kuraga’ to sell to local people. Haydarhuja's wife and children help him in the business. His business from dried fruits gives enough income. 

His family need more income and that’s why he wants to develop his business further. This year he made few ‘kuraga’ and Haydarhuja wants to buy additional ‘kuraga’ to sell to local people. He is asking for a loan to buy ‘kuraga’ to expand his business. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy more kuraga to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El socio Jose nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él se dedica a la confección de zapatos y tiene un pequeño taller pero el local es alquilado. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.
