loans.use: to purchase small shrimp to raise and resell in the future

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married with 2 children. Lilian is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lilian operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years and every month she earns 2,500 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. 

Lilian has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Lilian hopes to gain a double income from her business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Laura Veronica

texts.es: La señora Laura verónica es una mujer que siempre está preocupada por los detalles que le faltan a su hogar y aparte de eso es una mujer y esposa muy trabajadora ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y una que otra ropa es nueva. Esta ocasión Laura quiere remodelar su sala ya que al ser el cuarto principal de su domicilio que junto con su esposo le han dedicado mucho trabajo, esfuerzo y trabajo sobretodo. El crédito otorgado a Laura es para compra de mercancía y para la realización de mejoras a su domicilio y como se comentaba en especial a su domicilio ella de la venta que realiza obtiene los ingresos para realizar algunos de los gastos de su familia como la compra de despensa pagos de algunos recibos y en esencial para sus hijos que son la fuerza de Laura todos los días ya que ella quiere darles una vida mejor y que ellos se superen como personas de bien.
texts.en:
Laura Verónica is a woman who is always concerned about the particulars that her household lacks.  She is also a very hard-working woman and wife.  

She sells second-hand clothes and sometimes new clothes.  

Laura now wants to remodel the living room.  She will do this because it is the main room of her house.  She and her husband have put a great deal of effort and work into their house.

The loan granted to Laura is to buy merchandise and to make improvements to her home.  She comments that it is especially for her house.  

From the sales she makes she gets income to cover some of the family expenses like buying groceries, paying some bills, and essentials for her children.  The children are Laura’s driving force every day.  She wants to give them a better life, and she wants them to be successful, good people.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to remodel a room.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung would like to take a further loan to buy more kinds of food to sell from her stall. Nhung's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and ingredients to sell from her stall

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep would like to take a further loan to buy cosmetic products and equipment for her shop. Diep's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and equipment for her shop.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán esta casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa de sus suegros ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos gracias a la  elaboración y reparación de zapatos de varones, mujeres y niños trabajando por más de diez horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora que facilitará en los estudios a sus hijos.
El sueño de Hernán, es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
Es la tercera vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y  la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Hernán is married and has two children who are of school age. They live at the house of his in-laws where they occupy two rooms that consist of brick walls and dirt floors. The house is located in the District of Villa Fátima in the city of La Paz.

Hernán currently generates income by making and repairing shoes for men, women, and children. He works more than 10 hours a day in order to cover expenses such as food, education, and basic services for his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a computer to help facilitate his children’s studies.

Hernán’s dream is to have a house of his own so that he can provide more comfort and security for his family. This is the third time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his children's studies.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang is married and has four children, three of whom still depend on her while the other has started a new family. Kang lives with her spouse and three children in her own house located in Kampot province. To bring up her children and provide them with a further education, Kang has devoted herself to a farming business, cultivating around two and a half hectares of farmland on which she primarily grows rice and other seasonal crops. She has been doing this type of business alongside her husband for over 20 years. Some of her children give her help in the business when they are available from their class schedule.

Kang would like to expand her business and increase her household income, however she doesn’t have enough capital to make it possible. In this matter, Kang is applying for a loan in the sum of 2,500,000 KHR to buy land for farming.  This purchase will enable her to make her business more viable and better her standard of living. In the future, she aspires to purchase various kinds of farm supplies to increase her farm productivity.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Luong

texts.en: Luong is requesting a new loan to upgrade her internet shop by buying more new game cards, upgrading computers, and buying some new equipment. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and to offer her customers a greater variety of services. She hopes that her new loan will assist her with increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and that it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to upgrade her internet shop.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy skin care products and other basic supplies for her beauty shop. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy skin care products and other basic supplies for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai would like to take a further loan to buy spare parts and equipment to serve a larger number of customers. Mai's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and equipment to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena es una madre de familai de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a un hijo en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito agrícola de Olmos. La comunidad es pequeña y esta formada por personas humildes y bastante trabajadoras, sus actividades principales son la agricultura y la ganadería.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas en su domicilio, ademas vende comida y golosinas en la escuela del centro poblado donde reside. Cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el rubro. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en el proyecto de irrigación de Olmos, un proyecto esperado por todos los pobladores de la zona ya que hará que mejoren las condiciones agrícolas de la zona. Los ingresos que ambos perciben los utilizan en el sostenimiento de su familia.

María desea adquirir más cerveza, gaseosas, golosinas para ampliar su negocio, asimismo desea adquirir materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su vivienda. Para lograr estas metas a corto plazo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2200 nuevos soles.

María tiene como meta a largo plazo poder contar con un local en donde pueda ofrecer los productos que ofrece, para ello trabaja incansablemente a diario y pone especial esfuerzo los fines de semana, que es cuando su negocio cuenta con mayor acogida.
texts.en:
María Magdalena, age 36, lives with her husband and child in one of the neighborhoods that make up the rural part of the agricultural district of Olmos.  It is a small community comprised of humble and very hard-working people.  Their main business activities are agriculture and livestock.

She sells beer and soft drinks at her home.  She also sells food and sweets at the school in the village where she lives.  She has several years of experience doing this.  Her husband is a worker on an Olmos irrigation project.  All of the inhabitants of the zone are waiting for the project because it will improve the zone’s agricultural condition.  They use the income that they both receive to support their family.

María wishes to get more beer, soft drinks, and candy to expand her business.  She also wishes to get construction materials to finish building her house.  In order to achieve these goals in the short term, she believes it is suitable to request a loan for 2,200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

María’s long term goals to be able to have a place where she is able to sell the products she offers.  In order to do this she works tirelessly every day, and she puts forth special effort on the week-ends.  That is when her business has the most customers.

loans.use: to buy more beer, soft drinks, and candy to expand her business.  She also wishes to get construction materials to finish building her house.

loans.name: Liscel

texts.en:
Liscel is married woman with 3 children. She is 23 years old and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Liscel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products, to earn a living. She's been in this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Liscel became a member of GDMPC in 2010. Liscel hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Glynne

texts.en:
Glynne is 32 years old. Glynne is married and has three children. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. 

Glynne sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community to earn her living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 from the business. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to repair a fishing boat used in her business. In 2011, Glynne joined GDMPC. 

In the future, Glynne wants to build a house and to pay for her children to finish studying.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat used in business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and has 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 42 years old and 2 of her children are in school.

Marilyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Cham

texts.en:
Cham, aged 23, is married and permanently lives with her spouse and a lovely young child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is appearing in the photo with her helpful husband. 

Cham runs a micro hog-raising business at home to add to her husband's income. She had a wooden pigpen where she has installed two pigs, for breeding purposes. A month after her piglets are born, Cham plans to separate them to another place in order to keep them healthier and secure from illness. She has been in this business for two years. 

With the loan amount of KHR 1,600,000, Cham will use buy feed for her pigs and, with the balance of the loan, she will purchase chemical fertilizers to ensure good growth of her rice crops. Cham hopes to make more income from her pig business; when they are full grown, she will resell the pigs. From her generated revenue, she will save for the future expansion of her business and for emergencies of the family.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs and chemical fertilizers to ensure good growth of her rice crops.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor is 48 years old, a married woman who has been living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is responsible for three school-aged children. To earn a living, Hor has operated a hog-raising business at home. This enables her to support her husband in generating income to uplift the family's living conditions, out of the poverty line. 

Despite her hardships, Hor has a strong commitment to develop her business and to help all of her children earn a degree in the future. Hor’s husband runs a transportation business, in motorcycle transport, to provide the family with their main income. He works outdoor from dawn to dust, seven days a week, just to meet the needs of the family.

Hor has been with HKL for six loans already and this will be her seventh cycle loan. She will use the funds to buy paint, spare parts, and gasoline for the maintenance of her husband’s motorcycle. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family, improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy paint, spare parts, and gasoline for the maintenance of her husband’s motorcycle.

loans.name: Quoc

texts.en: Quoc would like to take a further loan to buy a greater quantity of confectionery from wholesalers to sell at more competitive prices. Quoc's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase sales. He also hopes that, through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and better quality of candies to sell.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of food such as beverages, sugars and cooking oil to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

Lan hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales. This will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of food such as beverages, sugars and cooking oil to restock her store.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying more clothes from different suppliers to satisfy her customers. Lang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. 

Lang also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more clothes from different suppliers to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales. This will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries for selling.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000, through NWTF, to buy materials for her fishing business. Cristina has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from buying and selling crabs.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she caqn afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more green tea, sugar, milk and spices tp sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Gemma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn works hard to support her family. Merlyn is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Merlyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Merlyn has been in this business for 28 years now.

In the future, Merlyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old and married with seven children.

Carmen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

Carmen has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Carmen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials to repair her fishing boat for her fishing/fish vending business.

Nancy has been in this business for 20 years. Nancy earns more income from her general store.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 33-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has two young children. She is in a food vending business selling snack foods in their place and in the school nearby. Gemma gives her best to lend a hand to her husband to meet their daily needs, especially for the education of their children. 
 
At this time, Gemma lacks additional capital for her business. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used to buy ingredients for the snack food that she is vending like flour, sugar, milk and other items. Some of the loan will be used to buy additional materials for the completion of her house.
Gemma hopes to increase her earning from her business and she is hopeful that one day she will be able to complete the construction of her house. Moreover, she wants to send her children to school for better learning.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the snack food that she is vending like flour, sugar, milk and other items

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to farming rice and selling fish. She is now 43 years old and married with two teenaged children. Recently, all of her children are attending school. She has been doing farming since she was a young girl living with her parents. In the last few years, she started her fish selling business in a local marker with the support of her husband, who always goes fishing and supplies fish for her. 

Because of decayed fishing materials, Va’s husband will have difficulty in his fishing activities. This will decrease their productivity and result in a low income for the family. To sustain her financial stability, Va decided to take out a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to add to her saving to purchase fishing materials such as fishing nets, gill nets, and hooks. Va hopes that she will be able to maintain her business and make a consistent profit to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as fishing nets, gill nets, and hooks.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rufina is 58 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rufina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rufina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like wood, paint, nails, etc for the repair of her fishing boat.

Rufina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rufina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Uy, 50 years old, is a business-minded woman who tries to pursue a better way of living. She has become a single parent living with some of her children in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She operates three businesses at the same time to obtain a high income for the family. She manages a farming business, serves Khmer noodles as breakfast for the local people, and weaves bamboo baskets. From her hard work and perseverance, Uy is able to cover her household expenditures and satisfy her basic living needs.

Uy is now seeking a loan through HKL in order to purchase chemical fertilizers to put on her rice crops. With the remaining funds, she will purchase rice to stock for her business selling Khmer noodles. Uy hopes that someday she can upgrade her living standard and attain a quality life as she continuously strives to work harder.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La Sra. Alicia de 31 años de edad tiene 3 hijos y es divorciada a pesar de las circunstancias ella ha sabido seguir adelante por sus hijos y por ella para ser un ejemplo de superación para ellos y demostrarles que con esfuerzo todo es posible. Ella es una mujer fuerte e independiente por lo cual tiene su propio negocio de abarrotes el que con mucho esfuerzo ha podido sacar adelante, su esposo no le ayuda en nada es por eso que ella esta pidiendo este crédito por que quiere surtir su negocio y darse a conocer mas para poder brindarle a sus hijos un mejor futuro y mostrarles con el ejemplo que todo se puede lograr.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 31, has three children and is divorced.  In spite of her circumstances, she has known how to get ahead for her children and herself.  She does this to be an example of self-improvement for them and to show them that, with effort, everything is possible.

She is a strong and independent woman, and she has her own grocery business.  By putting great effort into the business she has been able to get ahead.  

Her husband does not help her with anything.  That is why she is requesting this loan.  She wants to stock her business.  She wants to be more well-known in order to give her children a better future and to show them an example of everything that can be achieved.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery business.

loans.name: Yum's Group

texts.en: Yum, 56, is living in a rural village of the Sampov district of Pursat Province. She has eight children, five of whom still need her support, as they cannot earn much money. Two of her dependent children are working for others for pay and some of the other children are still at school. Yum has been farming for 30 years on two and half hectares of farmland as her main source of income. She also plants watermelons, raises chickens, and works for others for a fee to earn additional income to support this big household. Her main challenge is the drought in the first quarter of this year that made her crop yield fruitless. To overcome this challenge, she formed a group of seven members who applied for a new loan. This is the fifth loan for Yum, the second loan for three of the members, the third loan for two of the members and the first loan for the last member. With success, Yum has managed to pay back all the past four loans and it has improved her living conditions so they are better than before. Now, she is applying for 1,300,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for harvesting fee. In addition, she is going to use some portion of the loan to buy 20 more chickens to raise. She hopes to earn more income from her current businesses so she can save some money to buy a new motorbike for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pay the harvesting fee and buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una madre de familia de 23 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad en una de las comunidades rurales que conforman el distrito agrícola de Mórrope, su comunidad es una zona bastante pequeña y humide de ambiente emprendedor en cuanto a sus actividades laborales y cooperacion con sus vecinos. 

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, en la parte posterior de su vivienda tiene corrales en los cuales cria animales menores como pavos, patos, pollos, etc. Y frente de su domicilio en un predio de propiedad de sus padres cria y comercia ganado porcino, caprino y ovino. Una vez desarrollados, ella vende sus animales en el mercado de la zona y con los negociantes que visitan el lugar.

Paula desea adqurir un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que desea invertir en la compra de alimento para animales y en animales menores con fines de engorde, y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de él como de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paula is 23 years old and lives with her spouse and two children, who are 5 and 2 years old, in one of the rural communities that comprise the agricultural district of Mórrope.  Her community is small and humble, with an entrepreneurial environment in terms of work activities and cooperation with neighbors.

Paula works raising and selling animals.  In the back of her home she has pens in which she keeps small animals, including turkeys, ducks, chickens, etc.  In front of her home in an area of property owned by her parents, she raises and sells pigs, goats and sheep. Once grown, the animals are sold in the area market and to traders who visit the site.

Paula hopes to obtain a loan of $575 to invest in purchasing animal feed and smaller animals with the intent of fattening them up.  In this way, she will be able to improve the quality of life of both her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and small animals to grow and sell.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El señor Héctor un hombre trabajador tiene una tiendita de abarrotes y aparte trabaja en una maquiladora de la cuidad al igual que su esposa, eso le genera ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia y sus dos hijos que dependen de el, la tiendita la atiende la esposa del señor Héctor y aparte ella se dedica a la venta de quesos que trae de fuera de la cuidad. Para el señor Héctor sus dos hijos son lo que lo mantiene vivo todos los días y los que le dan la fuerza para seguir adelante todos los días. El crédito lo solicita para levantar una barda enfrente de su domicilio. Para el el estudio de sus hijos es lo más importante es por eso que el sueño de él es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se puedan superar  mejor en un futuro.
texts.en: Héctor is a hardworking man that has a convenience store and also works in a manufacturing company in the city along with his wife, this generates enough income for him to support his family including two children that depend on him, the store is serviced by his wife, she also sells cheeses that she brings from out of town.  For Hector his children are what keeps him alive and what gives him strength to get ahead every day.  The loan requested is to build a wall across from his home.  To him studies for his children are the most important thing that's why his dream is to see his children finish their studies so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is from a low-income family; she finished only her elementary education. She is 19 years old, married, and has been blessed with an infant child. 

Van aims to provide a good education to her child, so that when she grows up, she will find a better job than what Van does, which is rice farming. Van and her husband help each other to manage their rice field. Taking good care of her crops will result in an abundant harvest in the coming season.

Van wants to make some repairs to her present thatched-roof house, which is sure to suffer from leaks during this coming rainy season. She would like to borrow KHR 1,500,000 to purchase timbers and miscellaneous construction supplies to have her house constructed. 

She hopes to have a suitable shelter and provide her family with comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase timbers and materials to have her house constructed.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo de 63 años de edad es pensionado y esta divorciado no tiene dependientes económicos por lo tanto no ha tenido el apoyo que una persona de su edad necesita aun asi esto no lo ha detenido de seguir adelante superándose dia a dia y luchar por lo que quiere ya que el es dueño de una vulcanizadora. El sabe y reconoce el valor que el mismo tiene es por eso que no se ha dejado vencer ante las adversidades de la vida. Reynaldo en esta ocasión pide de nuestra ayuda para invertir en su negocio y dar mantenimiento a sus maquinas ya que estas son muy delicadas y ahí que hacer mejoras dia a dia. Agradecerá mucho la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Reynaldo is 63 years old, he is retired, divorced and doesn't have people that depend on him financially, he doesn't have the support that a person his age needs, but this hasn't stopped him to get ahead day to day and fight for what he wants which is the dream to have a tire repair shop.  He knows and recognizes the courage that it takes which is why he hasn't let himself get down when facing the challenges of life.  Reynaldo asks for your help to invest in his business and give maintenance to his machinery because they are delicate and need improvements everyday.  He is thankful for the help you will provide.

loans.use: to give maintenance to the machines of his tire repair shop

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Sothy is a 32-year-old married woman with three kids, all still in school. She is a quarry worker.  She has had that job for 10 years, and it supports her family as the main source of income. To better feed her household, Sothy also plants cassava and sells grocery items. From current businesses, she is able to earn about KHR 12,000  per day. 

Sothy has been with VisionFund for three times and successfully repaid all her loans. The past loans have helped her to improve her standard of living. 

In a confident manner, she is leading a group of five to request a new loan. Her amount is KHR 1,400,000, while three members are applying for KHR 1,000,000 each, and the remaining one is seeking KHR 500,000.  

Sothy will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and some of it to buy more grocery items, such as food ingredients, instant noodles, and canned foods, for resale. She hopes her cash crop thrives, so she can earn more profit in order to keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 22 years old and single.

Sarah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Sarah has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run the general store for three years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Sarah aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 26 years old and married, with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Christy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her business.

Christy has been raising pigs for three years, and she also earns additional income from ready-to-wear and a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her business raising pigs.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 60 years old and widowed.  She lives in Las Aguadas, Bonifacio Extension, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Vivian operates a motorcycle transport service for a living. She has operated her service for 11 years, with a monthly income of PHP 6,000. 

Vivian is in need of capital to purchase spare parts and accessories. She requested a loan at GDMPC of PHP 15,000.  She's been a GDMPC partner since 2010. 

In the future, Vivian hopes that she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Richell

texts.en:
Richell, a 34-year-old married mother of two children, is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental where she has been operating a specialized retail store selling a variety of food products in the local community for five years. She earns a monthly income of about 7,000 PHP.

In 2011, Richell joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Joe Ann

texts.en:
Joe Ann, a 43-year-old married mother of seven, lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where she owns and operates a general store, earning a monthly income of about PHP 20,000.

A member of GDMPC since 1995, she is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase new items to expand product offering. In the future, Joe Ann hopes to widen her selling area and acquire new products to sell to sustain the business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.es:
Edeliza tiene 20 años. Conformó su familia al lado de su esposo Teodoro y su pequeño hijo Bruno desde hace dos años y actualmente viven en la casa de su madre en la localidad de Daniel Hernández.

Junto a su esposo se dedican a la construcción, mientras él realiza el trabajo pesado junto a los peones, ella se encarga de cocinar los almuerzos para todos, así pueden terminar la obra más rápido. Gracias a sus esfuerzos pudieron ahorrar y ahora ya se encuentran construyendo su propia casa en el terreno que le heredó su madre. Ella espera seguir apoyando a su esposo en la construcción de más casas para mejorar sus ingresos económicos, pues aunque su hijo aún es pequeño, ellos desean brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y promete seguir con los pagos de manera puntual. Le gusta mucho trabajar en el grupo al que acaba de ingresar, pues le están enseñando cómo administrar su dinero.
Edeliza invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias tablas de madera, clavos y fierros para las construcciones que realizan.
texts.en:
Edeliza is 20.  Two years ago she formed a family with her husband Teodoro and son Bruno, they currently live at her mother's house in the local community of Daniel Hernandez.

Together with her husband they work in construction, while he does the hard labour work, she cooks for all the workers, this way they can work more and finish the project faster.  Thanks to their efforts they saved money and are now building their own house at a piece of land inherited by her mother.  She hopes to keep supporting her husband in the construction of houses to increase their income because even though their son is young, they want to be able to give him a better quality of life.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make the repayments punctually.  She likes to work with the group that she joined because they are showing her how to manage her money.  Edeliza will invest the money requested in buying several pieces of wood, nails and iron for the construction projects they are working on.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and iron for her construction business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 24 años. Vive en una casa alquilada desde hace un año en la localidad de Santa Rosa, allí conformó su familia al lado de su esposo Wilmer y pronto nacerá su primer hijo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales y elaboración de queso, tiene dos vacas de buena raza, a las que dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo. Ahora no puede hacer mucho esfuerzo física, pues dentro de un mes nacerá su primer hijo “Por él deseo trabajar con más esfuerzo, tres veces más”, nos dice. Es así que desea aumentar la cantidad de su ganado para poder producir más leche, ya que ahora realiza un promedio de cinco moldes de queso diarios, pero desea incrementar esa cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, promete seguir con los pagos de manera puntual, como en los anteriores créditos. Cuenta que gracias a este préstamo puede invertir en la mejora de su negocio. Y le gusta mucho trabajar con su grupo, ya que le enseñan a administrar su dinero. 
Margarita invertirá este dinero en la compra de una vaca lechera de buena calidad para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Margarita is 24 years old. She has been living for a year in a rented house in the town of Santa Rosa with her husband, Wilmer, and she will soon give birth to their first child.

She raises animals and makes cheese. She has two cows of good breed and dedicates most of her time to them. Currently she is not able to exert herself much since her first child is due within the month. “Because of him, I want to work even harder, three times harder,” she tells us. Consequently she wants to increase the number of cattle she owns so she can produce more milk because she produces an average of five molds of cheese daily now, but she wants to increase that number in order to improve her earnings.

This is her fourth loan from MFP and she promises to continue making payments punctually as she has with previous loans. She says that, thanks to this loan, she will be able to invest in improvements in her business. And she enjoys working with her communal bank because they teach her how to manage her money.

Margarita will invest this money in the purchase of a good quality dairy cow in order to expand her cattle.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is the mother of two children. She lives together with their father and long term partner. Since they are living in deteriorated housing, which she is renting, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to improve her house situation by purchasing building materials to finish building her house.

Santa is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost 3 years ago for a loan to expand her business. She lives in a slum area in the north of Santo Domingo. Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show reliability in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure, while running their business loans and attending groups meetings.

loans.use: To buy concrete block, cement, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a married woman who has two children. She is 34 years old and resides at Poblacion 3, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Mary Jane provides general repair services to local community members to earn a living. She's been in this business for 11 years. Each month, she earns 25,000 PHP doing this work. She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to widen the services she provides. Mary Jane has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to widen the repair services she provides

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco used his last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. His business is successful, and he is taking out a new loan to pay labor costs for farm maintenance. In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for farm maintenance

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a 44-year-old married woman who has seven children, five of whom are in school. She has 3 years of experience in poultry breeding. Her son helps her to breed poultry. She mostly keeps local chickens which are popular throughout the year. Demand for fresh poultry meat has risen and therefore she is requesting a loan amounting to Ksh 20,000 to purchase chicks and chicken feed.
Umazi would like to expand her business and purchase more poultry. This will be her first loan with Yehu and she hopes to repay her loan on time so that she can apply for another in order to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Mbiti

texts.en: Mbiti is a married man. He has 7 children with ages ranging from 19 years to 43 years. He describes himself as an ambitious and business-oriented person. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, salt, flour, milk, bread, sweets etc. Mbiti has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a busy environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation of household items. Mbiti will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more household items. His business goal is to run a new retail shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have diversified his business and increased his income so as to support his family.

loans.use: to buy more household items to sell in his store

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en: Zeny is from Kinangay Sur, Clarin. She is 45 years old. Zeny is married and has 1 child. To make a living, she manages a charcoal making business. She has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns 3,400 a month for these activities. In 2004, Zeny joined GDMPC. Zeny is requesting a loan of 4,000 which will be used to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has 3 children whose ages range from 6 to 15 years old. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. For the past 2 years, Mary has operated a retail store where she sells items such as sugar, salt, flour, milk, bread, sweets, etc . Her business is located within a conducive business environment and her primary customers are local residents. Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation.

Mary will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more household items. Her business goal is to expand her retail shop into a wholesale one within 5 years. Mary hopes that, in the future, she will have had expanded her business so as to increase her daily income.

loans.use: to buy more household items.

loans.name: Chidziphi

texts.en:
Chidziphi has operated a meat goat business for the past 8 years. He works hard to meet his family's needs. His wife is engaged in farming. They work together to maintain the family's expenses so that they can live in dignity.

Chidziphi tells us that his business is doing very well and that he has managed to increase his monthly income by over 30 percent. He is requesting his second loan with Yehu in order to buy more goats for sale. He gives thanks for the help that he is receiving from Kiva and Yehu, and he promises to fully invest it in his business so that it can expand. His dream is to own a butchery.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface, 38 years old, is married to Roseline and blessed with three children. For the last twelve years, he has been selling motor spare parts, earning a monthly income KES 16,500.

Boniface was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers. He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase spare parts such as fan belts, bearings, brushes and plugs. Boniface will reinvest the anticipated profit back into his business. His future dreams are to have a happy and stable family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as fan belts, bearings, brushes and plugs.

loans.name: Pearl Marie

texts.en: Pearl Marie lives in Bliss Lapasan, Misamis Occidental. She has provided transportation services for 8 years to support her child's needs, earning a monthly income of PHP 6,000. For a 32-year old mother, there’s nothing that can make her more happy than seeing her child successful. Without hesitation, Pearl Marie is borrowing PHP 40,000 from GDMPC microcredit to repair her transport vehicle to provide her child with a better education. She joined GDMPC in 2009. Pearl Marie's plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married and has 4 children, one of whom is in school. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education and since her husband's income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, about 6 months ago, Luvuno decided to start working, selling maize in a small store at her home in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home's finances. 
Thanks to the increasing number of customers, Luvuno is looking for a loan to purchase sacks of maize that will allow her to increase her stock capacity and offer a better service to her customers. This way, she will get through and her business will continue to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is a single mother of two children who both go to school. She takes care of additional family members (father and sisters). She has a business selling bunches of bananas. Hadjah has applied for a loan of 500000 Ugandan shilling to buy more bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for six years and works six days a week at the wholesale market. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she gets enough profits to buy a delivery van to help transportation, and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas for sale

loans.name: Helda

texts.en: Helda is a married woman who has 2 children. She is 51 years old and resides at Alindahaw, Tukuran. Helda sells fish and shrimp to the local community to earn a living and she has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair her fishing boat. Helda has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Helda wants to help her children finish their studies..

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep would like to take another loan to buy good quality food and ingredients for making nice dishes to sell from her stall. Diep's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality food and ingredients to make dishes to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is married and has 4 kids. She is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. Rosita is a farmer and she operates a banana production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and every month she earn 4,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of 6,900 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Rosita has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 28 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa, además de jovial y sociable. Está separada del padre de su único hijo. Actualmente vive con su hijo, sus padres (en la casa de ellos) y sus cinco hermanos.
Su actividad económica es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad. Para eso cuenta con una bodega instalada en la casa de su padre. Se inició hace más de un año con un capital propio viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de sus padres, con mucha alegría y entusiasmo, en la atención a sus clientes. También cuenta con un empleo en una empresa privada, teniendo de esa manera varias fuentes de ingresos, pues antes de iniciar con esta actividad tenía problemas económicos. Pero ahora, viendo sus buenos resultados, tienen planes de incrementar su negocio y seguir creciendo.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que espera concretar sus planes. Por tanto, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Y además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche y otros para tener un buen stock en su bodega. Todo esto comprará a precio por mayor para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancia.
texts.en:
Virginia is 28 years old and a very hard-working as well as good-humored and friendly woman. She's separated from the father of her only son. Currently she lives with her son, her parents (in their home), and her five brothers.

She sells essential groceries as her job. For this she has a grocery store installed in her father's home. It began more than a year ago with her own capital after seeing the need to have an additional income, and until now she has happily and enthusiastically run it with the support of her parents while looking after her customers. She also has a job with a private business, in this way having several sources of income as she had financial problems before beginning this business. But now, after seeing the good results, they have plans to expand her business and continue growing.

This is her first loan with the MFP institution due to which she hopes to fulfill her plans. Therefore she has committed to fulfilling the payments of what she owes. Moreover, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.

With the requested total of 1000 nuevos soles she will invest in the purchase of groceries like rice, sugar, milk, and other items in order to have a good supply in her grocery store. She will buy all this at a wholesale price in order to have higher earning margins.

loans.use: to buy groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc.) to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Touch is aged 40 years and married with one dependent son who is still in school. To feed the family, she has been raising cows for 10 years and her husband works as a policeman. She can earn about KHR 24,400 per day from the current business. Touch’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has successfully used the past loans to better support her family and has completely paid back all the loans. In addition to the current business, she wants to raise chickens for resale as extra income. Hence, she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. She is seeking 300,000 KHR while her group member is applying for 200,000 KHR. She hopes to get more income from her current businesses so as to make a good living and keep his son in school.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: James

texts.es:
James tiene 46 años, es un hombre honesto, responsable y muy trabajador. Mantiene una relación de pareja desde hace 12 años con Deysi, con quien tiene dos hijos de 12 y 7 años. Vive al lado de toda su familia en una casa que alquilan desde hace unos meses y día a día se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de sí por el bien de toda su familia.

Su trabajo consiste en brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros. Tiene un motocarro que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo y que le permite realizar este trabajo con mucha eficiencia, aunque por ahora está teniendo algunas dificultades por el uso frecuente que le da y por los años que ya lleva con el mismo, pues tiene 16 años. Por otra parte, desde hace un año, alquila un espacio de la casa de su cuñado para su taller de vulcanizado, ahí trabaja de manera eventual arreglando vehículos, pero generalmente trabaja sólo su cuñado y comparten las ganancias del día. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque genera sus propios ingresos y puede administrar su tiempo de la forma que él decida, sin descuidar las actividades que requiere cumplir en su casa como padre de familia. Actualmente desea que su taller también sea una tienda grande de repuestos y accesorios para motos, de ese modo espera incrementar sus ingresos y mantener su cartera de clientela.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y agradece a las personas que le brindan su confianza y el apoyo crediticio que necesita para continuar trabajando en el cumplimiento de sus metas. Por otra parte espera recibir todo la ayuda que requiera para trabajar junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal.

Con el monto solicitado, 400 nuevos soles, comprará algunas llantas, rodajes y cámaras para ponerlos a la venta en su taller y de esta forma empezar a implementarlo poco a poco.
texts.en:
James is 46 years old and is an honest, responsible, and hardworking person. He has been in a relationship for 12 years with Deysi, with whom he has two children who are 12 and 7 years old. He lives with his family in a house they have rented for two months. He works every day to give the best to his family.

His work consists of providing transportation to passengers. He has a motorcycle taxi that he was able to buy after a lot of hard work and which allows him to do his job very efficiently.  He has been having some problems with it lately due to how much he uses it and because of how old it is, because it is 16 years old. Also, for more than a year now, he has rented some space in the house of his brother-in-law for a tire repair shop. There he works from time to time fixing vehicles, usually with his brother-in-law and they split the earnings each day. He likes his work very much because he is able to earn his own income and he can manage his time however he decides, without having to miss out on activities at home for his family. He currently would like for his shop to be a large store for replacement parts and accessories for motorcycles. In this way he expects to increase his income and also maintain his existing clients.

This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is grateful to the people who give him the trust and the financial support that he needs in order to continue working toward his goals. He also hopes to receive all the help he needs in continuing to work together with the members of his communal bank. 

With the amount he has requested, PEN 400.00 (nuevos soles) he will buy some tires and inner tubes to sell in his store so that he can begin to stock his store, little by little.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and accessories for stocking his store

loans.name: Erik

texts.es:
Erik tiene 24 años, es muy jovial y con el ímpetu que caracteriza a los jóvenes emprendedores. Día a día se esfuerza trabajando para ofrecerle a su hijo Iker, de 8 meses, y a su pareja  todo lo que se merecen. Por el momento viven en la casa de su madre, junto a su familia, además de sus dos hermanos y en conjunto ponen todo el esmero para poder lograr tener una buena calidad de vida.

Él se dedica es al transporte de personas por la ciudad. Trabaja todos los días por horas programadas. Tiene un motocarro propio desde hace 5 años, desde entonces ha trabajado en esta actividad y por su habilidad para convencer a los pasajeros, consigue buenas ganancias durante toda su jornada, las que le permiten solventar los gastos familiares. Sin embargo, ahora tiene la necesidad de seguir trabajando por su pequeño bebé, es por eso que desea comprar otro motocarro para alquilarlo y de esta forma asegurar otro ingreso económico. Lamentablemente, considera que el préstamo solicitado no es conveniente para cumplir esa meta a corto plazo, es por eso que desea refaccionar su motocarro actual para que funcione perfectamente y con el dinero que obtiene de ello ir ahorrando para comprarse el otro vehículo.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está agradecido con las personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder a esta oportunidad. Espera seguir trabajando con su banco comunal de manera responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, con el objetivo de que más adelante tenga la opción de obtener créditos mayores.

Con el monto solicitado, de 400 nuevos soles, comprará llantas nuevas y remodelará el tapizado y algunas otras piezas de su motocarro.
texts.en:
Erik is 24 years old, and is very jolly with the motivation that characterizes young entrepreneurs.  Day after day he works hard to offer his 8 month old son, Iker, and his partner, all that they deserve.  Currently they live in his mother's house along with his family and his two brothers.  As a group they take great care to succeed in having a good quality of life.

He works transporting people through the city.  He works everyday on a schedule.  He has had a motorcycle taxi for the last five years, during which he has worked in this line of work.  Due to his ability to persuade passengers, he earns good profits throughout his shift which allows him to afford family expenses.  Nevertheless, he now has a need to continue working for his little baby.  It is due to this that he wants to buy another motorcycle taxi that he could rent out and this way earn another source of income.  Unfortunately, he believes that the loan requested is not sufficient to complete this goal in the short term.  For this reason he hopes to repair his current motorcycle taxi so that it functions perfectly.  With the money that he obtains from it, he will begin saving to buy himself the other vehicle.

This is Erik's first loan with MFP and he is grateful for the people that make this opportunity possible.  He hopes to continue working with his community bank, responsibly making his payments, with the objective of having the option for greater credit in the future.

With the amount requested, 400 nuevos soles, he will buy new tires and replace the upholstery and some other pieces of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his motorcycle taxi and renovate the upholstery.

loans.name: Rozikboy

texts.en:
Some years ago Rozikboy worked in Russia, but he didn’t like it there and returned to his own town. He had little children and his wife didn’t work anywhere so that’s why he decided to organize his own business deal. 

He bought a car and began to carry furniture from his town to other towns and regions. He is a client of one local furniture shop. He serves people who buy furniture by transporting it to their houses. He has been developing his business as he is very cute and industrious. 

Nowadays, he is going to change his car but does not have enough money for it. He is asking for a loan to buy a new car for developing his business. You are the only one who can help him. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new car for his furniture transport business.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
Karla tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, con mucha decisión y ganas de progresar. Tiene una hija, Karla de 6 años, a quien cría y educa con mucho esmero. Actualmente vive en el local alquilado para su negocio y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para poderle brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.

Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos variados. Toda su mercadería la compra en la ciudad capital, donde los obtiene a menor precio y de modelos diferentes. Empezó con esta actividad hace más de 3 años y la considera rentable por la demanda que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, es muy feliz cuando vende toda su mercadería, es por eso que espera lograr tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con MFP y está muy contenta porque cuenta con un respaldo financiero para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Por eso sabe que tiene que ser muy responsable y sobre todo puntual en sus pagos. También está feliz de pertenecer su banco comunal, pues  considera que todos son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará más mercadería consistente en zapatos y zapatillas de diversas marcas, en modelos para damas, caballeros y niños, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, ya que desea armar su campaña de fiestas patrias.
texts.en:
Karla is 41 years old and a very simple and hard-working woman with much decisiveness and a desire to progress. She has a daughter, Karla, who's 6 years old whom she raises with great care. Currently she lives in the shop rented for her business and what she desires most is to work very hard in order to give her daughter a better quality of living.

She makes a living selling a variety of shoes. She buys all her merchandise in the capital city where she obtains it at a lower price with different style selections. She began this job more than three years ago and considers it profitable due to the demand that she has and the good earnings it leaves her with. She likes her job a lot and is very happy when she sells all her merchandise. It's because of this that she hopes to manage to have a bigger store where she can make sales in greater comfort.

This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very happy because she has a financial backing with which to increase her work capital. Due to this she knows that she has to be very responsible and above all, punctual, with her payments. She is also happy to belong to her communal bank as she considers everyone to be very supportive.

With the requested total of 1000 nuevos soles she will buy more merchandise consisting of shoes and sneakers of various brands, in styles for women, men, and children. She will look for low prices because she's buying in bulk as she would like to supply her National Holidays campaign.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and sneakers for her National Holidays campaign.

loans.name: Pak

texts.en:
Pak is 37 years old and married with five children, some of whom are employed to help their mother with the family expenses. 

Pak is a local cultivator who grows various sorts of seasonal crops such as rice, sugar cane, and vegetables on around three hectares of farmland. She has been engaged in this for many years and has had constant support from her spouse. This couple works hard to cover their household needs and improve their ways of living.

For her first loan, Pak would like to purchase a cow for the maintenance of the rice field. And at the same time, she also will raise this cow for offspring. She believes that this loan will allow her to make improvements to her business. 

Pak is very appreciative and promises to pay her loan back on time, so then she will be able to obtain another loan to develop her business as well as her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Oscar Arnaldo

texts.es: Oscar es de Bastión Popular sector norte de Guayaquil donde tiene su taller de mecánica automotriz, el aprendio esta actividad de su padre quien fue quien le enseño desde muy joven, segun pasaba el tiempo conocio a su actual esposa con quien se caso se caso y fueron a vivir a Bastión con su familia, su casa al principio era de caña pero con esfuerzo poco a poco fue construyéndola de cemento. En su taller ofrece todo tipo de servicios pero lo que más buscan sus clientes es enderezada, este servicio lo ofrece con la ayuda de un vecino quien complementa su actividad. También vende repuestos de carro en general. El mayor problema de Oscar es la delincuencia ya que su taller es pequeño y cuando tiene mucho trabajo debe dejar los carros fuera lo que es aprovechado para robarles las piezas. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de una grúa hidráulica lo cual necesita para bajar los motores de los carros. Espera mejorar considerablemente sus servicios con la maquina y así empezar la construcción del segundo piso de su casa para ocupar toda la parte baja en el taller.
texts.en: Oscar is from Bastión Popular, a sector north of Guayaquil, where he has his auto mechanic's workshop. He learned this trade from his father, who was the one who taught him from the time he was very young. As time passed, he met the woman who is now his wife. He married and they went to live in Bastión with her family. Their house at the beginning was of thatch, but with effort, little by little, he constructed it of cement. In his shop he offers all types of services, but what his customers ask for most is body work, a service that he offers with the help of a neighbor whose work complements his. He also sells spare parts in general. Oscar's greatest problem is crime. Since his shop is small. when he has a lot of work he has to leave the cars outside, which thieves take advantage of to steal parts. The loan that he is applying for is to purchase a hydraulic crane, which he needs to lower the motors of the cars. He hopes to improve his services considerably with this machine and thus begin constructing the second floor of his house, so that the lower part can be used entirely for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy a hydraulic crane

loans.name: Deidy

texts.es:
Deidy tiene 48 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora. Junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos de 20, 14 y 13 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Actualmente vive junto a su familia en la casa de su madre, donde también viven sus tres hermanos. 

Su trabajo consiste, principalmente, en la venta de comida, considera que tiene un negocio muy rentable desde su casa, ya que afirma que siempre tiene clientes que acuden a ella fielmente para deleitarse con su exquisita sazón. Su especialidad es la comida rápida regional, ya sean “tamales” o “humitas” elaborados principalmente con maíz y carne, acompaña sus potajes con deliciosas bebidas de frutas o gaseosas. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 2 años, desde las 3 de la tarde, hasta las 10 de la noche. Recibe, generalmente, la ayuda de su hija de 13 años y su actividad le permite generar buenos ingresos a su hogar. Adicionalmente, durante el día, vende frutas de la región, mientras comparte su faena en la preparación de la comida que pondrá a la venta. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que siempre le ha fascinado la cocina. Fue muy complicado poder establecer su negocio, ya que antiguamente vendía golosinas caminando por las calles, pero no le generaba buenas ganancias, a pesar de ello nunca se rindió y hoy tiene muchos planes con su actual negocio.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores. Además desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios.

Con el  monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará maíz por kilos, carne de pollo y cerdo, aceite por litros, maní, aceitunas y condimentos para continuar con la preparación de sus potajes; también renovará algunos de sus utensilios, haciendo un total de 500 nuevos soles. Invertirá otros 500 en comprar frutas por sacos y con el monto restante comprará gaseosas y cervezas.
texts.en:
Deidy is 48 years old and a kind, good, and hard-working woman. With her partner they have three children of 20, 14, and 14 years of age to whom she desires to give a better quality of life. Currently she lives with her family in her mother's home where her three siblings also live.

Her work mainly consists of selling food. She considers herself to have a very profitable business from her home since she affirms that she always has customers that faithfully come to her to take delight in her food's delicious flavors. Her specialty is regional fast food, whether it be "tamales" or "humitas" made mainly with corn and meat, accompanied by her stews with delicious fruit drinks or soft drinks. She has been doing this job for two years, from three in the afternoon until ten at night. She generally receives help from her 13-year-old daughter and her work allows her to generate good earnings for her home. Additionally, during the day she sells fruit from the region while she shares her work preparing the food that she will sell. She likes what she does a lot as cooking has always fascinated her. It was very complicated for her to be able to establish her business since in the past she used to walk through the streets selling sweets. However, this didn't generate good earnings for her. Despite this she never gave up and nowadays has many plans for her current business.

This is her third loan with MFP. Therefore she hopes to continue with her objectives. On the other hand she commits herself to continue being a punctual member as with her previous loans. Moreover, she desires to continue working with the members of her communal bank since all of them are kind and supportive.

With the requested total of 1500 nuevos soles she will buy corn by the kilogram, chicken and pig meat, oil by the liter, peanuts, olives, and sauces in order to continue with the making of her stews. Also, she will update some of her utensils, making a total of 500 nuevos soles. She will invest another 500 in buying fruit by the sack, and with the total that's left she will buy soft drinks and beer.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs for her meals and some drinks, to update her utensils, and to buy the fruit that she sells in the morning.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Salvador de 32 años de edad es casado y tiene 4 hijos que dependen de él económicamente. El trabaja en un puesto de tacos y gorditas y su esposa es ama de casa juntos se han siempre esforzado por sacar adelante a su familia siendo siempre un ejemplo para sus hijos de superación y esfuerzo, el quiere brindarle a sus hijos y esposa un mejor futuro económico es por eso que en esta ocasión pide de nuestra ayuda para compra de materia prima e instalación ya que el quiere iniciar su propio negocio de comida.  Agradecería la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Señor Salvador is 32 years old. He is married and has four children who depend on him economically. He works at a taco and gordita stand, and his wife is a housewife. Together they have always striven to raise their family, always being an example for their children of effort and overcoming. He wants to offer his children and wife a better economic future. It is for this reason that he is now asking for our help to buy basic ingredients and pay for setup, since he wants to begin his own food business. He will be grateful for the help that can be offered.

loans.use: to pay for basic ingredients and setup expenses for his business.

loans.name: Cristina Alicia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Cristina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la elaboración y  comercialización de muebles para el hogar y la oficina. Cristina en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado comprar material como madera prensada para la elaboración de sus muebles.
Cristina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of communal bank "Los Lideres" (The Leaders) located in Cusco, Peru.  She continues to make a living in the creation and sale of home and office furniture.  In this instance, Cristina will invest the loan to purchase material such as plywood to build furniture.  

Cristina is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to provide a better quality of life for her family and helping her maintain and develop her trade.  She is grateful for this loan and promises to repay in accordance with the loan agreement.

loans.use: to purchase plywood

loans.name: Zenda

texts.en:
Zenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a flower shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy floral supplies, tools and equipment for her flower shop business.

Zenda has been in this business for 23 years. Zenda earns more income from selling personal products.

Zenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy floral supplies, tools and equipment.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Argentina is 32 years old and has four children who are in school.

Argentina has an abaca (fiber) weaving business in the Philippines. Argentina requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

Argentina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Argentina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca (fiber) weaving.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Luisa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes y maquillajes, actividad que viene realizando hace mucho tiempo y con la cual saca adelante a su familia. Luisa en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar productos de belleza y cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes, que son mujeres en su mayoría.
Luisa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the communal bank "Los Lideres" (the leaders) in Cusco, Peru.  She continues to make a living selling beauty products such as perfume and makeup which she has been doing for a long time and with which she supports her family.  In this instance, Luisa will invest the loan to purchase beauty products to fulfill customer requests which are mostly women.  

Luisa is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her the opportunity to give her family a better quality of life and for helping her grow and strengthen her business.   She appreciates this loan and promises to repay the loan in accordance with the loan agreement.

loans.use: to purchase women's perfume and makeup.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,el socio hace desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,el socio da pension familiar,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,elsueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida.El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,verduras,pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues to work in his food business. He makes breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. He has a boarding house. He works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. His dream is to expand his business of selling food. He is applying for the loan to buy products for cooking, such as rice, vegetables, chicken, and meat.

This communal bank member is happy because of the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, chicken, and meat

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es:
Jannet tiene 27 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 7 años es Denis, con quien tiene dos hijos, uno de 4 años y un pequeño bebé de tan solo un mes.
